net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services

Class SingletonServiceTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services.SingletonServiceTest

  • public class SingletonServiceTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Exercises SingletonService. Note that the quality of Android Service testing is inherently unstable, so a failure on any given run is not necessarily indicative of a failure in the class's operation.
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.1.2 (#3)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SingletonServiceTest.FirstContext
      Provides one of the multiple contexts across which we will test the service instance.

      Provides one of the multiple contexts across which we will test the service instance.
      static class  SingletonServiceTest.SingletonServiceTestContext
      Provides one of the multiple contexts across which we will test the service instance.

      protected SimpleTestServiceConnection<SingletonService> m_conn
      A persistent connection to the service.

      The Android instrument that allows us to kick off the service inside the test.

      A persistent reference to the service.

      • SingletonServiceTest

    • Method Detail

      • testAcrossContexts

        public void testAcrossContexts()
        Attempts to verify that the singletons written into the service are accessible even when written from multiple contexts. Note that, because of the way service testing works in Android, this test case is inherently unstable, and returns a lot of false negatives.

      • testNonMapMethods

        public void testNonMapMethods()
        Exercises the more exotic methods of SingletonService.

      • teardown

        public void teardown()
        Tears down the object references maintained by the test class.
